caption: We visited this beautiful Catholic Church April 2019 for Easter Mass. As a Altar Boy from the 60's I found this to be a great example of what you'd expect to see in a Catholic Church from this period.  Very friendly congregation. An elderly lady greeted everyone at the end of each pew with the famous French Cheek Kiss. What a surprise to my wife and I who had traveled here from Texas.  Beautiful music with pipe organ from the balcony above and behind us. If you want a great experience visit this Church during a service even if you are not Catholic. The Church exudes history. It's a must see while in Paris.
Beautiful church. It’s in my neighborhood so I stop in every now and then. The bells toll throughout the day. So magical.

We walked past this place a few times since it was close to our Airbnb. AT first glance I thought it was a temple because of the large pillars out front. It wasn't until after looking at the carving and the cross that I figured out it was a church. There were also statues in the walls of the building. I didn't have time to go in but did look it was open in the mornings.
Very nice ash Wed mass
Quiet place to rest the old bones for a few minutes after a long day exploring in Paris.
Saint Denis of the Sacrament, spectacular, interesting, uplifting. If churches are your thing this is a must see!
I visited many churches in Paris. This one was not open to the public, it appears when there is no service.
It's a Catholic Church. Very oldest and largest space.
It is located in the Marais district in the 3rd arrondissement. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

The facade does not necessarily invite you to enter. However, this church surprises with its height and depth. Far from the tourist areas, it remains alive with its regular visitors. Calm place for contemplation and meditation.
Very sober on the outside, this church built in the shape of a Roman Basilica conceals true masterpieces

What a marvel! Very sober on the outside, this church built in the shape of a Roman Basilica conceals true masterpieces (sublime grisaille painting, Delacroix's Deposition of the Cross, etc.) A must see. Very easy access for all

Superb church, between simplicity and baroque. Magnificent stained glass windows with very beautiful colors! The nave is decorated with a superb fresco and a magnificent pediment painted to the glory of Jesus Christ. A fairly rare floor since this one is made of beveled parquet slats.. I have never seen this elsewhere.. There are also great paintings, one of which is Eugène Delacroix yes, Delacroix! It symbolizes the descent of Christ from the cross, Mary, his mother who welcomes him in her arms, is completely defeated. Mary Magdalene also appears on this representation of a scene from the life of Christ. Below this one , there is a sculpture of St. Mary, it is also very beautiful.. This church, at first glance simple, looking more like a temple than a church, reveals all its beauty to us as soon as we pass through the large doors. It is magnificent, serene, bright and full of charm! A station of the cross goes around, the scenes are made of enameled terracotta, they are all sober and simple. I loved this moment of solemn peace, this moment when time stops to fill us with peace and serenity.. To discover for pleasure but also for the suspended moment

Beautiful Catholic church in the center of Paris. The low relief of the expulsion from Paradise, the statues of Saint Joan of Arc, Saint Michel and Pope John Paul II and the beautiful stained glass windows create an environment of peace and meditation!!
Very beautiful neoclassical church from the 19th century which is worth the detour, particularly for the remarkable Pietà by Delacroix and its architectural ensemble.

Magnificent church which contains a painting by Delacroix: the descent from the cross after the crucifixion of Jesus. The painting has been renovated and illuminates the entire church with its presence. A must see.
Very beautiful church with a painting by Delacroix inside. To visit
Large space dedicated to Saint Denis where there is a soothing calm. Very beautiful church.

I went there for my little sister's communion and I must say that it is a magnificent church. Large enough to accommodate a few hundred people. There are very beautiful illuminations etc. The cure was very welcoming and the children at heart too… I recommend this church to people in the neighborhood
Beautiful neoclassical church, well preserved and well presented.
Its interior surprises with its conception, depth and decoration. If you find it open, do not hesitate to enter.
Magnificent Delacroix, very friendly.
I loved this church. You have to go see it.

It is a quiet place to pray with a seminary and the danger that the backyard outside the church becomes a place of passage open to all comers by the town hall while this place is closed and belongs to the parish as normal.  Provided that this is not done by municipal decree, a petition is available to people in the parish and the more we sign the more weight will be given to our opposition to opening the place to all comers.
Great church and good sound for sacred music concerts grztitude
An extraordinary priest. A very beautiful church. A mecca of spirituality in Paris with the presence of a community of seminarians who liven up the celebrations beautifully. Worth the detour.

The Saint-Denys-du-Saint-Sacrement church, located 70 rue de Turenne...(metro: Saint-Paul..Filles du Calvaire...Chemin Vert...) Named in memory of the first bishop of Paris, Saint Denis (preserving an ancient spelling of the name of this saint called Dionysius in Latin)... The neoclassical architecture and decoration are typical of the early 19th century and very similar to Saint-Pierre-du-Gros-Caillou. From the outside, it looks like a kind of Roman temple, a bit like the Madeleine or St Pierre-Du-Gros-Caillou....and inside also with all these columns and its rectangular shape... The church's notoriety is also due to the fact that it houses (in the first chapel on the right) a Pietà executed in 17 days by Delacroix in 1844, "this masterpiece which leaves a deep furrow in the mind melancholy” according to Baudelaire, which is very beautiful and very large and covers the entire top of the wall of the chapel...! A recent restoration also revealed the beauty of the Pilgrims of Emmaus, a work painted in wax by François-Edouard Picot. Look at my photos to get a better idea!!
The church is worth a look. There is also a painting by Eugène Delacroix. Possibility of having a guided tour. To do!
1 magical place on Sunday 1 singer with 1 breathtaking voice wow
Small church where rest and meditation are faith.... this one is quite charming and the interior is pleasant to visit...
Superb Church of Saint Denys of the Blessed Sacrament. Rue de Turenne Marsh district.

The parish of my first twenty years. I have good memories of its organs and the improvisations of the organists at the end of the services; I have rarely found similar ones abroad or in the Province.  I have bad memories of two Cub Scout leaders from this parish who practiced sexual touching in summer camp and of a Scout chaplain from this parish who practiced moral harassment (before the term existed) in confession, at presbytery. The three were expelled from their positions in scouting.

Houses a Pietà executed in 1844 by Eugène Delacroix. Built between 1826 and 1835 and named in memory of the first Bishop of Paris, this neoclassical church also houses two large 19th century organs and four other murals, including one by the neoclassical painter François-Édouard Picot, which are also worth seeing. 'eye !
Tenor without fuss but tremolos I indulge in spectacle and give voice in this enchanting place for non-Catholic humanitarian concerts with my mouth in chorus... note-et-bien.org
Good atmosphere, smiling waiter. No doorman though. Which earns it a rating of 3+ Visited in rainy weather 😎  To the wise 😇

Françoise and Father Tardy have their hearts on their sleeves!! They are always there to help you, listen to you, enrich you with a nice word and reassure you with a smile and/or a word. Thank you so much !!
Magnificent church, You can come and listen to some concerts among others Passion Leitmotiv concert Choirs and Orchestra
Beautiful and pleasant neo-classical church from the 19th century (1826-1835) in the middle of rue de Turenne. Facade with four columns.
